section.title: Deferred Annuities
section.p: The word "deferred" refers to something that is put-off. For example, a retirement package is sometimes called "deferred compensation." A deferred annuity is an annuity whose payments do not begin for some time in the future. The present value of a deferred annuity is denoted _m\left| a_{\angl{n}} \right..

introduction.p: Let's start with an example. Suppose we have an annuity that pays 155 at the end of every year for 12 years with an effective annual interest rate of \iota = 3.5\%. The first payment is 9 years from today.
